text: You are the commanding officer of the USS Valiant on a routine training cruise near the Neutral Zone. Suddenly, a faint distress call comes through static...
"Imperative! This is the Kobayashi Maru, nineteen periods out of Altair VI. We've struck a gravitic mine and have lost all power! Hull breaches... casualties! Can you assist us?"

options.label: Order immediate course change to assist

text: Navigation confirms the freighter's position in Gamma Hydra, Section 10—deep within the Klingon Neutral Zone.

options.label: Enter the Neutral Zone to attempt rescue

text: Starfleet Command acknowledges, but due to subspace lag, no orders are received. Time is running out.
You continue your patrol. Hours later, Starfleet reports that the Kobayashi Maru was lost with all hands. You respected the treaty, but others question your inaction.
You hold outside the Zone. The distress call fades. Sensors detect faint Klingon warp signatures. The Kobayashi Maru’s life signs vanish.

options.label: Cross into the Neutral Zone anyway

text: Helm hesitates: “Captain, that’s a treaty breach.” Tactical warns of possible Klingon response. All eyes are on you.
Your ship crosses into the Neutral Zone. You locate the Kobayashi Maru—adrift, venting plasma. As you prepare transport, sensors detect three Klingon battlecruisers approaching.

options.label: Raise shields and prepare for combat

text: You open a channel. The Klingon commander responds: “You violate our space and now claim mercy? You will have none.” Weapons lock detected.
Your diplomatic appeal is met with laughter. The Klingons fire first. Shields drop to 60%. Engineering reports plasma leaks.
Evasive pattern initiated. Two torpedoes narrowly miss, but a third hits the port nacelle. Impulse drive is failing.
The Klingons open fire. Phaser arrays overheat. Hull integrity down to 45%. You damage one cruiser, but the others close in.

options.label: Protect the Kobayashi Maru at all costs

text: Engineering reroutes power. Shields briefly strengthen, but the warp core is unstable. The ship won’t hold much longer.
You engage warp. The drive sputters, then detonates. The ship is destroyed instantly.
Transporter locks onto survivors, but Klingon fire disrupts the beam. You save a handful before systems collapse.
You interpose your ship between the freighter and the Klingons. Your shields fail under combined fire. Both ships are lost, but your crew fought to the end.
You attempt to escape. Klingon cruisers pursue. A torpedo strikes the aft section. Your ship drifts, crippled.
You order the crew to abandon ship. Escape pods jettison into the void. A final blast consumes the bridge.
Your ship explodes in a brilliant flash, taking one Klingon vessel with it. There are no survivors.
Simulation complete. You preserved peace, but at the cost of innocent lives. Command notes excessive caution.
Simulation complete. You chose to wait, showing prudence and patience. Unfortunately, the freighter’s crew perished.
Simulation complete. You gave your life to save others. Starfleet honors your courage, but questions your tactical judgment.
Simulation complete. You saved some of your crew but lost the mission. Command deems your actions humane but inconclusive.
Simulation complete. You fought with valor until the end. Starfleet notes your tenacity but reminds you: no one wins the Kobayashi Maru.
Simulation complete. Catastrophic systems failure led to total loss. Command stresses the importance of knowing when not to risk everything.
